discover.instruction: Read about what this family can do. Notice 'can' and 'can't'.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о том, что умеет эта семья. Обрати внимание на 'can' и 'can't'.

content.text: My family has many talents! I <highlight>can</highlight> play the guitar. I <highlight>can</highlight> also sing. My sister <highlight>can</highlight> dance very well, but she <highlight>can't</highlight> sing. My brother <highlight>can</highlight> play football. He <highlight>can't</highlight> play tennis though. My mother <highlight>can</highlight> cook delicious food. My father <highlight>can</highlight> speak three languages. He <highlight>can</highlight> speak English, French, and Spanish. <highlight>Can</highlight> you play any instrument?
content.question: What form comes after 'can'? Does it change for he/she?
content.question_ru: Какая форма глагола идёт после 'can'? Меняется ли для he/she?

points.example: I can swim. She can swim. (NOT: She cans swim)
I can't drive. He cannot cook.
Can you swim? Can she speak English?
I can play piano (ability). Can I go? (permission). Can you help me? (request)

comparison_table.structure: Yes, I can. / No, I can't.
comparison_table.example: Can you drive? Yes, I can.

notice.instruction: Find all uses of 'can/can't'. Identify: ability, permission, or request.
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все случаи 'can/can't'. Определи: способность, разрешение или просьба.

tasks.text: My friend Tom is very talented. He can play the piano and the guitar. He can also speak Japanese. But he can't cook at all! Yesterday, he asked me, 'Can you teach me to cook?' I said, 'Of course, I can help you.' At my house, he asked, 'Can I use your kitchen?' I said yes. Now he can make simple meals. He still can't make anything complicated, but he's learning!

find.phrase: He still can't make anything complicated

notice.reflection_question: How is 'Can you help?' different from 'Can I go?'
notice.reflection_question_ru: Чем отличается 'Can you help?' от 'Can I go?'

sentences.sentence: She ___ speak French. She learned it in school.
I ___ drive. I don't have a license.
He ___ cook. His food is terrible.
We ___ see the mountains from here.
I ___ hear you. Please speak louder.

questions.explanation: Past ability = could (but at A1, 'can' is main focus)

produce.instruction: Write about what you can and can't do.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о том, что ты умеешь и не умеешь делать.
prompts: Sports and physical activities you can/can't do
produce.example: I can swim and I can ride a bike. I can't play tennis. I can speak English and Russian. I can't speak French. I can play the guitar, but I can't play the piano. I can cook simple meals. I can't drive yet.
criteria: Uses 'can't' for things they cannot do

texts.title: Job Interview
texts.content: Interviewer: What can you do? Applicant: I can speak English and German. I can use Microsoft Office. I can work in a team. I can't speak Chinese, but I can learn quickly. Interviewer: Can you work on weekends? Applicant: Yes, I can.

texts.title: Superhero
texts.content: Superheroes have amazing powers. Superman can fly. He can also see through walls. Spider-Man can climb buildings. He can't fly, but he can swing on webs. Batman can't fly or climb, but he can fight very well. He can also drive cool cars.

texts.title: Baby's Progress
texts.content: My baby is one year old. She can walk now! She can say a few words. She can't talk in sentences yet. She can eat with her hands. She can't use a spoon well. She can recognize her family. Can she read? No, she can't.

texts.title: Classroom Rules
texts.content: In class, you can ask questions. You can use a dictionary. You can work with a partner. But you can't use your phone. You can't eat in class. Can you drink water? Yes, you can. Can you leave early? No, you can't.

texts.title: My Pet
texts.content: My dog Max is smart. He can do tricks. He can sit and give his paw. He can fetch a ball. He can't open doors. He can understand simple commands. Can he speak? Of course not! But he can communicate with his eyes.

grammar_cards.back:
She can swim.

can + base verb (no -s)

Can you help?

Subject + can → Can + subject

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"He can to play guitar."
grammar_cards.back:
He can play guitar.

No 'to' after can

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"She cans speak English."
grammar_cards.back:
She can speak English.

'Can' never changes form

common_errors: Using 'to' after can (I can to swim)
